title: Basic_TimeTeller_Analysis
text: package builds work Original publication Methodology, showed potential TimeTeller act independent cancer biomarker microarray data, extended algorithm RNA-seq data performed extensive validation available mouse, baboon human datasets. TimeTeller supervised machine learning tool analyses local circadian clock system. aims estimate circadian clock phase level dysfunction single sample modelling multi-dimensional state clock. TimeTeller package implements algorithm including methodology improvements tools visualisation.

title: Basic_TimeTeller_Analysis
text: vignette look two datasets: human oral mucosa

text: Vadim Vasilyev. Author, maintainer.

title: Bjarnasson microarray data — bjarn_data
text: dataset containing oral mucosa expression profiles 10 healthy individuals taken 6 different time points 4 hours apart. memory speed considerations 1000 randomly selected probes together clock probes selected (removed).

title: Bjarnasson microarray data — bjarn_data
text: list containing following: expr_mat fRMA normalised expression matrix group Individual (order corresponds columns expression matrix) time Actual sampling time (order corresponds columns expression matrix) probes_used Clock gene probes used training model

title: Bjarnasson microarray data — bjarn_data
text: Bjarnasson Oral Mucosa

title: Covariance matrix ellipsoid volume — check_cov_interp
text: displays volume (area) hyper-ellipse given confidence level (https://datavis.ca/papers/ellipses.pdf). Can useful diagnostics analysis covariance matrix interpolation

title: Covariance matrix ellipsoid volume — check_cov_interp
text: object list containing TimeTeller training test models following train_model alpha confidence level used volume calculation

title: Covariance matrix ellipsoid volume — check_cov_interp
text: Returns plot volume hyper-ellipse local projections using graphics::matplot

title: Covariance matrix ellipsoid volume — check_cov_interp
text: Vadim Vasilyev

what: Rhythmicity analysis of training data — choose_genes_tt
title: Rhythmicity analysis of training data — choose_genes_tt
text: Calculates rhythmicity results training data

title: Rhythmicity analysis of training data — choose_genes_tt
code: choose_genes_tt(   object,   group1,   group2,   group3,   replicate,   method = "population",   parallel = TRUE,   cores = 4 )

title: Rhythmicity analysis of training data — choose_genes_tt
text: object list containing TimeTeller training test models following train_model test_model respectively method method used rhythmicity analysis. Default 'population' https://tbiomed.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1742-4682-11-16 parallel TRUE, parallel computation using foreach doParallel packages used. Default TRUE cores using parallel computation, many cores used. Default 4 grouping_var samples grouped rhythmicity analysis. either provided manually one following: 'Group_1', 'Group_2', 'Group_3' 'Replicate'

title: Rhythmicity analysis of training data — choose_genes_tt
text: Returns plots theta calculation curves produced using standard graphics::plot

title: Rhythmicity analysis of training data — choose_genes_tt
text: Cornelissen, G., 2014. Cosinor-based rhythmometry. Theoretical Biology Medical Modelling, 11(1), pp.1-24.

title: Rhythmicity analysis of training data — choose_genes_tt
text: Vadim Vasilyev

title: Log Threshold selection — choose_logthresh
text: iterate though multiple values logthresh save relevant metrics . Can used aid selecting appropriate threshold. See ?choose_logthresh_plot visualisation

title: Log Threshold selection — choose_logthresh
code: choose_logthresh(   object,   max_log = 0,   min_log = -12,   by_step = -1,   train_or_test = "test" )

title: Log Threshold selection — choose_logthresh
text: object list containing output train_model test_model functions max_log max value logthresh considered. Generally recommended check [0,-12] range min_log min value logthresh considered by_step step size logthresh optimisation. found -0.5 sufficient, however users may benefit granular data depending application train_or_test whether simulation run 'train' 'test' data

title: Log Threshold selection — choose_logthresh
text: returns data.frame containing results log threshold selection

title: Log Threshold selection — choose_logthresh
text: Vadim Vasilyev

text: Plots results choose_logthresh function

title: Log Threshold selection plot — choose_logthresh_plot
text: choose_logthresh_df data.frame containing output choose_logthresh function cap parameter used clarity visualisation. Ratio LogLik 1st 2nd peaks perc_flat option target particular proportion samples flat likelihoods (ie peak currently selected LogThresh)

text: returns ggplot object

title: Log Threshold selection plot — choose_logthresh_plot

Display the results of cosinor rhythmicity analysis — display_rhythmicity_results
text: object list containing output train_model choose_genes_tt functions probes_of_interest genes / features interest highlight info_used plot style output. Must one 'ranks' 'original'. Choosing 'ranks' allows interactivity using ggplotly organism added convenience. attempt use gprofiler2::gconvert get Entrez gene symbols user-friendly visualisation. Therefore, argument format consistent .

Visualise the the estimated temporal expression of test data — exprs_vs_PredTime_plot
text: object list containing TimeTeller training test models following train_model test_model respectively genes genes / features interest used plotting theta_thresh threshold used theta classification 'Good' 'Bad' clocks. can subjective used visualisation sanity check xlim_l lower limit x axis. Helps visualisation samples cluster particular part day (eg biopsy samples taken mostly day time) xlim_u upper limit x axis

title: Rhythmicity analysis of selected geneset — geneset_rhythm_info
text: object list containing TimeTeller rhythmicity results following choose_genes_tt geneset geneset interest labels genes highlight resulting polar plot group1 subset Group_1 (Metadata provided) used group2 subset Group_2 (Metadata provided) used group3 subset Group_3 (Metadata provided) used replicate subset Replicate (Metadata provided) used method method used rhythmicity analysis. Default 'population' https://tbiomed.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1742-4682-11-16

text: Returns array containing single cosinor results (MESOR, Amp Rhythmicity test Pval) polar plot summary info

title: Panda data — panda_data
text: Mice subjected ALF TRF feeding schedule gene expression changes examined samples taken 22 organs brain regions collected every 2 hours 24-hour period (https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/36599299/). look subset extensive study, particular TRF non-brain regions. Expression profiles reported underwent basic library depth filtering CPM normalised. left 378 samples memory speed considerations 1000 randomly selected genes together clock genes selected analysis.

title: Panda data — panda_data
text: list containing following: expr_mat CPM normalised expression matrix group Organ (order corresponds columns expression matrix) time ZT sampling time (order corresponds columns expression matrix) replicate '1' '2' (order corresponds columns expression matrix) genes_used Clock gene probes used training model

title: Panda data — panda_data
text: Deota et. al (2023)

title: Panda data — panda_data
text: Deota, S., Lin, T., Chaix, ., Williams, ., Le, H., Calligaro, H., Ramasamy, R., Huang, L. Panda, S., 2023. Diurnal transcriptome landscape multi-tissue response time-restricted feeding mammals. Cell metabolism, 35(1), pp.150-165.

title: Cross-validation results on the training data — plot_deviation_cv_corrected
text: Visualisation results following train_cv function. Plots prediction error actual time. function can useful systematic deviations (eg chronotype) suspected, case error adjusted median. Care taken otherwise, also mask algorithm's systematic error, therefore plot_deviation_cv_original plot_cv_res recommended first steps

what: Project test data on the training model — test_model
title: Project test data on the training model — test_model
text: Projects test data onto model obtained running train_model function. Among outputs estimated time sample clock dysfunction metric (Theta)

title: Project test data on the training model — test_model
code: test_model(   object,   exp_matrix,   test_grouping_vars,   test_group_1,   test_group_2,   test_group_3,   test_replicate,   test_time,   mat_normalised_test = TRUE,   log_thresh,   parallel_comp = FALSE,   cores = 4,   minpeakheight = -Inf,   minpeakdistance = 1,   nups = 1,   ndowns = 0,   threshold = 0,   npeaks = 2 )

title: Project test data on the training model — test_model
text: object object class list containing timeteller training model (obtained running train_model function) exp_matrix matrix data frame containing test data features rows samples columns test_grouping_vars groups used timecourse_matched normalisation. See vignette examples test_group_1 vector containing metadata sample (eg individual, organ). required intergene normalisation, however may useful visualisation. timecourse timecourse_matched normalisations, however, important supplied format training data ensure consistent results test_group_2 vector containing metadata sample (eg individual, organ) test_group_3 vector containing metadata sample (eg individual, organ) test_replicate vector containing replicate information available test_time vector containing replicate information available. affect results useful calculate prediction error hence algorithm accuracy mat_normalised_test expression matrix supplied already normalised (eg RMA microarray, CPM/TPM RNA, etc) . , edgeR::cpm function used (pseudocount 2) obtain log normalised values downstream analysis. Default TRUE log_thresh log threshold selected. important parameter chosen carefully.Please read help(choose_logthresh_plot) information parallel_comp TRUE, parallel computation using foreach doParallel packages used. Default FALSE cores using parallel computation, many cores used. Default 4 minpeakheight used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development. Please consult ?pracma::findpeaks, needed, information minpeakdistance used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development nups used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development ndowns used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development threshold used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development npeaks used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development

title: Cross-validate the TimeTeller model — train_cv
text: Cross-validation TimeTeller model using provided expression matrix metadata. Single multiple groups can selected CV

title: Cross-validate the TimeTeller model — train_cv
code: train_cv(   group_to_leave_out = "group_1",   genes,   exp_matrix,   test_grouping_vars,   group_1,   group_2,   group_3,   time,   replicate,   mat_normalised = TRUE,   treat_independently = TRUE,   combine_for_norm = FALSE,   parallel_comp = FALSE,   cores = 4,   method = "intergene",   grouping_vars = c("Group"),   num_PC = 3,   log_thresh,   epsilon = 0.4,   eta = 0.35,   cov_estimate = "normal",   alpha_par = 0.75,   num_interp_points = 144,   interp_method = "perpchip",   cov_path = "spline",   minpeakheight = -Inf,   minpeakdistance = 1,   nups = 1,   ndowns = 0,   threshold = 0,   npeaks = 2 )

title: Cross-validate the TimeTeller model — train_cv
text: group_to_leave_out group cross-validation done . example, group_1 contains sample individual group_2 contains sample organ information, selecting 'group_2' result CV done organs opposed individuals (ie leave one organ testing, train rest). Must one 'group_1', 'group_2', 'group_3' 'replicate' genes genes used train TimeTeller model exp_matrix matrix data frame features rows samples columns test_grouping_vars group variables (eg 'group_1', 'group_2' combination c('group_1','group_2')) used timecourse_matched normalisation. cross-validation grouping_vars group_1 vector containing metadata sample (eg individual, organ) group_2 vector containing metadata sample (eg individual, organ). Leave empty unavailable group_3 vector containing metadata sample (eg individual, organ). Leave empty unavailable time vector containing timing sample. Please appreciate difference CT ZT replicate vector containing replicate information available mat_normalised expression matrix supplied already normalised (eg RMA microarray, CPM/TPM RNA, etc) . , edgeR::cpm function used (pseudocount 2) obtain log normalised values downstream analysis. Default TRUE treat_independently replicates averaged (might useful technical replicates, recommended biological replicates). Default TRUE combine_for_norm replicates combined normalisation. TRUE, replicates combined normalisation purposes (eg timecourse normalisation, replicates combined treated one timeseries). Default FALSE parallel_comp TRUE, parallel computation using foreach doParallel packages used. Default FALSE cores using parallel computation, many cores used. Default 4 method method used normalisation. Must one 'intergene', 'timecourse', 'timecourse_matched', 'clr' grouping_vars group variables (eg 'group_1', 'group_2' combination c('group_1','group_2')) used timecourse_matched normalisation num_PC many principal components used analysis. Default 3 log_thresh log threshold selected. important parameter chosen carefully. Please read help(choose_logthresh_plot) information epsilon hyperparameter value used theta calculation. reason change , information https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.03.14.532177v1. Default 0.40 eta hyperparameter value used theta calculation. reason change , information https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.03.14.532177v1. Default 0.35 cov_estimate type covariance estimate used. 'normal' selected, Rfast::mvnorm.mle used. 'robust' selected, rrcov::CovMcd used instead. can useful lot training data, suspected high technical noise. Since want ignore biological noise (eg chronotype) often hard tell two apart, default 'normal' alpha_par following rrcov package (case 'robust' chosen ) parameter controlling size subsets determinant minimized. Allowed values 0.5 1 num_interp_points number interpolation points use mean spline covariance matrices. Default 144 corresponds 24 * 60 / 144 = 10 minutes interp_method method used spline interpolation. Must one 'perpchip' (uses adapted periodic version pchip pracma package) 'standard' (uses periodic version standard spline function splines package). cov_path method covariance matrix interpolation. Must one 'spline' (case covariance matrix interpolated element-wise using interp_method selection) 'fisherrao' (case geodesics based Fisher–Rao metric Gaussian distributions used). minpeakheight used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development. Please consult ?pracma::findpeaks, needed, information minpeakdistance used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development nups used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development ndowns used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development threshold used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development npeaks used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development

title: Train the TimeTeller model — train_model
text: Trains model using provided expression matrix metadata.

title: Train the TimeTeller model — train_model
code: train_model(   exp_matrix,   genes,   group_1,   group_2,   group_3,   time,   replicate,   mat_normalised = TRUE,   treat_independently = TRUE,   combine_for_norm = FALSE,   parallel_comp = FALSE,   cores = 4,   method = "intergene",   grouping_vars = c("Group"),   num_PC = 3,   log_thresh,   epsilon = 0.4,   eta = 0.35,   cov_estimate = "normal",   alpha_par = 0.75,   num_interp_points = 144,   interp_method = "perpchip",   cov_path = "spline",   minpeakheight = -Inf,   minpeakdistance = 1,   nups = 1,   ndowns = 0,   threshold = 0,   npeaks = 2 )

title: Train the TimeTeller model — train_model
text: exp_matrix Matrix data frame features rows samples columns genes genes used train TimeTeller model group_1 vector containing metadata sample (eg individual, organ) group_2 vector containing metadata sample (eg individual, organ). Leave empty unavailable group_3 vector containing metadata sample (eg individual, organ). Leave empty unavailable time vector containing timing sample. Please appreciate difference CT ZT replicate vector containing replicate information available mat_normalised expression matrix supplied already normalised (eg RMA microarray, CPM/TPM RNA, etc) . , edgeR::cpm function used (pseudocount 2) obtain log normalised values downstream analysis. Default TRUE treat_independently replicates averaged (might useful technical replicates, recommended biological replicates). Default TRUE combine_for_norm replicates combined normalisation. TRUE, replicates combined normalisation purposes (eg timecourse normalisation, replicates combined treated one timeseries). Default FALSE parallel_comp TRUE, parallel computation using foreach doParallel packages used. Default FALSE cores using parallel computation, many cores used. Default 4 method method used normalisation. Must one 'intergene', 'timecourse', 'timecourse_matched', 'clr' grouping_vars group variables (eg 'group_1', 'group_2' combination c('group_1','group_2')) used timecourse_matched normalisation num_PC many principal components used analysis. Default 3 log_thresh log threshold selected. important parameter chosen carefully. Please read help(choose_logthresh_plot) information epsilon hyperparameter value used theta calculation. reason change , information https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.03.14.532177v1. Default 0.40 eta hyperparameter value used theta calculation. reason change , information https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.03.14.532177v1. Default 0.35 cov_estimate type covariance estimate used. 'normal' selected, Rfast::mvnorm.mle used. 'robust' selected, rrcov::CovMcd used instead. can useful lot training data, suspected high technical noise. Since want ignore biological noise (eg chronotype) often hard tell two apart, default 'normal' alpha_par following rrcov package (case 'robust' chosen ) parameter controlling size subsets determinant minimized. Allowed values 0.5 1 num_interp_points number interpolation points use mean spline covariance matrices. Default 144 corresponds 24 * 60 / 144 = 10 minutes interp_method method used spline interpolation. Must one 'perpchip' (uses adapted periodic version pchip pracma package) 'standard' (uses periodic version standard spline function splines package). cov_path method covariance matrix interpolation. Must one 'spline' (case covariance matrix interpolated element-wise using interp_method selection) 'fisherrao' (case geodesics based Fisher–Rao metric Gaussian distributions used). minpeakheight used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development. Please consult ?pracma::findpeaks, needed, information minpeakdistance used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development nups used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development ndowns used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development threshold used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development npeaks used internally pracma package locate peaks. reason change, however included future testing / development

title: Train the TimeTeller model — train_model
text: Returned rich object class list containing TimeTeller model analysis

title: Train the TimeTeller model — train_model
text: Vlachou, D., Veretennikova, M., Usselmann, L., Vasilyev, V., Ott, S., Bjarnason, G.., Dallmann, R., Levi, F. Rand, D.., 2023. TimeTeller: tool probe circadian clock multigene dynamical system. bioRxiv, pp.2023-03. Amari, S.. Nagaoka, H., 2000. Methods information geometry (Vol. 191). American Mathematical Soc..

title: Train the TimeTeller model — train_model
text: Vadim Vasilyev

title: Train the TimeTeller model — train_model
code: library("TimeTeller") tt_model <- train_model(exp_matrix = bjarn_data$expr_mat, genes = bjarn_data$probes_used,                         group_1 = bjarn_data$group, time = bjarn_data$time, log_thresh = -5) #> Please check the information provided: #> # Number of genes used: 9  ( 202861_at 205251_at 209750_at 209782_s_at 209824_s_at 210971_s_at 213462_at 221045_s_at 39549_at ) #> # Number of Group_1 levels: 10  ( Ind_1 Ind_2 Ind_3 Ind_4 Ind_5 Ind_6 Ind_7 Ind_8 Ind_9 Ind_10 ) #> # Number of Group_2 levels: 1  ( NA ) #> # Number of Group_2 levels: 1  ( NA ) #> # Number of Replicate levels: 1  ( NA ) #> # Number of unique time points Used for training: 6  ( 8 12 16 20 24 28 ) #> Replicates (if there are any) will be treated as independent observations for the training model #> Using intergene normalisation #> Data loaded and successfully normalised #> Calculating projections and interpolating densities... #> Using standard Covariance and Location estimation #> Calculating likelihoods... #>  Finished 1 of 6  #>  Finished 2 of 6  #>  Finished 3 of 6  #>  Finished 4 of 6  #>  Finished 5 of 6  #>  Finished 6 of 6  #> Calculating additional info... #> Finished!
